Jan Algermissen wrote:
> The first sentence in 9.6. which you for whatever =
reason did not quote:

> 
> "The PUT method requests that the enclosed enti=
ty be stored under the
>supplied
> Request-URI"

I didn't quote it, because=
 I don't think "stored under the supplied URI"
is well-defined enough to ru=
le out my interpretation. And, in fact, as you
point out,
httpbis spends a =
lot more text than RFC2616 does in describing what PUT
means, from which I =
will draw the conclusion that PUT is either
underspecified or underexplaine=
d in RFC2616, hence the confusion.

> These days, it is always helpful to c=
heck the forthcoming version of the
>spec:
>
> http://tools.ietf.org/html/d=
raft-ietf-httpbis-p2-semantics-17#section-6.6
>
> (see last two paragraphs =
of 6.6)

Fair enough, considering httpbis has as a charter "saying what we =
REALLY
meant to say when we wrote RFC2616". ;) I agree partial updates are =
ruled
out by the httpbis description of PUT.


Jon
